events.title: Deepfake Election Law (AB 730)
events.summary: Prohibits the distribution of materially deceptive audio or visual media of a candidate within 60 days of an election.

events.title: Digital Replicas Laws (AB 2602, AB 1836)
events.summary: Protects performers from unauthorized digital replicas in contracts (AB 2602) and protects the digital likeness of deceased personalities (AB 1836).

events.title: Deepfake Election Deception Laws (AB 2655, AB 2839)
events.summary: Requires platforms to block deceptive election content (AB 2655) and restricts distribution of election deepfakes (AB 2839).

events.title: California AI Transparency Act (SB 942)
events.summary: Requires large generative AI providers to create AI detection tools and include disclosure options for AI-generated content.

events.title: Generative AI Training Data Transparency (AB 2013)
events.summary: Requires developers of generative AI systems to publicly disclose information about the data used to train their models.

events.title: Transparency in Frontier Artificial Intelligence Act (SB 53)
events.summary: Establishes a comprehensive framework for frontier AI safety, requiring large developers to publish safety frameworks and report critical incidents.

events.title: AI Safety and Defense Laws (AB 316, AB 621, SB 243)
events.summary: Prevents 'autonomous AI' defenses in liability claims (AB 316), expands deepfake pornography protections (AB 621), and regulates companion chatbots (SB 243).

events.title: Oregon Consumer Privacy Act (SB 619)
events.summary: Establishes comprehensive consumer data rights, including the right to opt-out of profiling and automated decision-making.

events.title: Artificial Intelligence Task Force (HB 4153)
events.summary: Creates a task force to study AI terms and definitions for potential future legislation, reporting findings by late 2024.

events.title: Campaign Finance and Deepfake Disclosure (SB 1571)
events.summary: Requires disclosure of the use of AI or other synthetic media in campaign advertisements to prevent voter deception.

events.title: Unlawful Dissemination of Intimate Images (HB 2299)
events.summary: Criminalizes the dissemination of AI-generated intimate images (deepfake pornography) by including digitally created or manipulated depictions in the definition of intimate images.

events.title: Facial Recognition Law (SB 6280)
events.summary: First state law regulating government use of facial recognition technology, requiring accountability reports and meaningful human review.

events.title: Artificial Intelligence Task Force (ESSB 5838)
events.summary: Establishes an Artificial Intelligence Task Force to assess current uses and trends of AI in state government and the private sector, and to make recommendations to the Legislature.

events.title: Prohibition of Forged Digital Likeness (HB 1205)
events.summary: Criminalizes the knowing distribution of a forged digital likeness (deepfake) to defraud, harass, threaten, or intimidate another person.

events.title: Deepfake Election Law (SB 751)
events.summary: Criminalizes the creation and distribution of deepfake videos intended to injure a candidate or influence an election within 30 days of the vote.

events.title: Texas Data Privacy and Security Act (HB 4)
events.summary: Comprehensive privacy law that includes consumer rights to opt-out of profiling and automated decision-making.

events.title: Stopping AI-Generated Child Pornography Act (SB 20)
events.summary: Creates new criminal offenses for the possession, promotion, or production of obscene visual material appearing to depict a child, including AI-generated content.

events.title: Deepfake Pornography Liability (SB 441)
events.summary: Expands criminal and civil liability for the creation and distribution of non-consensual deepfake pornography, including still images.

events.title: Texas Responsible AI Governance Act (HB 149)
events.summary: Establishes the Texas Artificial Intelligence Council and prohibits government entities from using AI for social scoring or biometric surveillance without consent.

events.title: Automated Employment Decision Tools (Local Law 144)
events.summary: Requires NYC employers to conduct bias audits on AI hiring tools and provide notice to candidates. Enforcement began July 2023.

events.title: Non-Consensual Deepfake Pornography Ban (S 1042A)
events.summary: Criminalizes the unlawful dissemination of AI-generated intimate images (deepfake pornography) without consent.

events.title: Election Deepfake Restrictions (S 8631 / A 9430)
events.summary: Requires political communications that use materially deceptive AI media to include clear disclosures. Part of the FY 2025 State Budget (El. Law 14-106).

events.title: LOADinG Act (S 7543A / A 9430B)
events.summary: Regulates the use of automated decision-making systems by state agencies, requiring transparency and prohibiting systems that affect public benefits or civil rights without authorization.

events.title: AI in Political Advertising (HB 919)
events.summary: Requires political advertisements containing AI-generated content to include a clear disclaimer stating 'Created in whole or in part with the use of generative artificial intelligence (AI).' Effective July 1, 2024.

events.title: Advanced Technology and AI Transparency (SB 1680)
events.summary: Creates the Government Technology Modernization Council to study AI and establishes safety standards for AI platforms to protect minors and ensure transparency. Effective July 1, 2024.

events.title: Deepfake Pornography and Child Exploitation (SB 1792 / HB 3)
events.summary: Criminalizes the creation and distribution of deepfake pornography, particularly targeting minors, and enhances penalties for possessing AI-generated child sexual abuse material. Effective July 1, 2024.

events.title: Colorado Artificial Intelligence Act (SB 24-205)
events.summary: Comprehensive regulatory framework for high-risk AI systems, requiring developers and deployers to use reasonable care to avoid algorithmic discrimination. Implementation delayed to June 30, 2026 by SB 25B-004.

events.title: Candidate Election Deepfake Disclosures (HB 24-1147)
events.summary: Requires clear and conspicuous disclosures on campaign advertisements that use AI-generated content (deepfakes) to depict candidates.

events.title: Artificial Intelligence & Biometric Technologies (HB 24-1468)
events.summary: Establishes the Biometric Technology and Artificial Intelligence Policy Task Force to study and recommend policies on AI and biometric technologies.

events.title: AI Strategic Task Force (Executive Order 629)
events.summary: Establishes the Artificial Intelligence Strategic Task Force to study AI/GenAI technology and advise the governor on implementation, economic impact, and ethical use.

events.title: Attorney General Advisory on AI
events.summary: Clarifies that existing state consumer protection, civil rights, and data privacy laws apply to AI developers and users, specifically regarding bias and transparency.

events.title: AI in Healthcare and Mental Health (SB 2632)
events.summary: Prohibits AI from making independent therapeutic decisions in mental health and requires human review for insurance utilization decisions. (Note: Passed Senate, likely pending House/Governor action).

events.title: Digital Impersonation Prevention (HB 2394)
events.summary: Allows individuals to sue for damages or injunctive relief if they are the target of a digital impersonation (deepfake) created without their consent.

events.title: Deepfake Political Ads Disclosure (SB 1359)
events.summary: Requires political advertisements that use AI-generated deepfakes to depict a candidate to include a clear disclosure within 90 days of an election.

events.title: Human Review in Health Insurance (HB 2175)
events.summary: Mandates that medical directors must individually review medical necessity denials, preventing insurance companies from relying solely on AI algorithms for claim decisions.

events.title: Political Ads AI Disclosure (HB 5141, HB 5143)
events.summary: Requires qualified political advertisements generated in whole or in part by artificial intelligence to include a clear and conspicuous disclosure.

events.title: Deepfake Election Ban (HB 5144)
events.summary: Prohibits the distribution of materially deceptive media (deepfakes) intended to influence an election within 90 days of the vote, unless disclosed.

events.title: Deepfake Pornography Liability (HB 4047, HB 4048)
events.summary: Establishes civil and criminal liability for the non-consensual dissemination of deepfake sexual images.

events.title: Combating AI-Generated Deepfake Images (SB 1213)
events.summary: Criminalizes the creation and dissemination of AI-generated child sexual abuse material and deepfake images of minors and non-consenting adults.

events.title: Digital Forgery Law (SB 649)
events.summary: Establishes a third-degree felony for using AI to generate fake voices, images, or videos (deepfakes) to defraud, injure, or scam individuals.

events.title: AI Leadership Council & Accelerator (Executive Order 24)
events.summary: Establishes the North Carolina AI Leadership Council and an AI Accelerator to guide state agencies on AI governance, literacy, and deployment.

events.title: Artificial Intelligence Video Interview Act (HB 2557)
events.summary: Requires employers to notify applicants and obtain consent before using AI to analyze video interviews.

events.title: AI in Employment Decisions (HB 3773)
events.summary: Amends the Human Rights Act to require employer notice for AI use in hiring and prohibits discriminatory AI practices.

events.title: Digital Voice and Likeness Protection Act (HB 4762)
events.summary: Protects individuals from unauthorized use of their AI-generated voice or likeness in commercial contracts.

events.title: Unauthorized Digital Replicas (HB 4875)
events.summary: Prohibits the distribution of sound recordings or audiovisual works containing unauthorized AI-generated digital replicas of individuals.

events.title: AI in Mental Health Therapy (HB 1806)
events.summary: Regulates the use of AI in providing mental health services, ensuring it does not replace professional clinical judgment.
